# Coding of Color
### Cones and Color Vision.
- B/W vision adequate for most purposes
- color vision is important in identifying ripeness, counteracting camouflage…
- humans, old world monkeys and apes have </br> 3 types of cones (3 iodopsins) providing elaborate color vision


---
name: 6-5-3
layout: true


# Coding of Color
.pull-left[
### Cones and Color Vision.
- mixing of colored light differs from pigment mixing
- red+yellow+blue = muddy gray pigment
- red+yellow+blue = white light
]
.pull-right[
### Trichromatic (Young-Helmholtz) Theory of Color Vision.
- .small[based upon observation that any color of light can be obtaining by mixing various amounts of red, yellow, blue]
- .small[proposed that humans have 3 kinds of photoreceptors that work together to give perception of color]
]


---
name: 6-5-4
layout: true

# Coding of Color
### Cones and Color Vision.
- cones exhibit maximal responses at .blue[420 (short)], .green[534 (medium)], or .red[564 (long) nm]
- determined by type of iodopsin in cone
- each cone responds over a range of wavelengths


---
name: 6-5-5
layout: true

# Coding of Color
### Opponent Process Theory of Color Vision. 
- based upon observation that some colors don’t blend
- based upon negative afterimages
- trichromatic theory cannot explain


---
name: 6-5-6
layout: true

# Coding of Color
### Opponent Process Theory of Color Vision. 
- 2 kinds of colour sensitivity in ganglion cells
    - "medium opposes long" 
    - "short opposes medium/long"


---
name: 6-5-7
layout: true

# Coding of Color
### Opponent Process Theory of Color Vision. 
- 2 kinds of colour sensitivity in ganglion cells
    - "medium opposes long" 
    - "short opposes medium/long"
- roughly concentric cone-fed inputs
